DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 1 Last 2 Weeks Pain and Disturbing Body Sensations Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their level of pain and disturbing body sensations (hot flashes, painful swelling of breasts, nausea, drowsiness), using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Pain and Disturbing Body Sensations Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about an individual's level of pain and disturbing body sensations._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Pain and Disturbing Body Sensations Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about an individual's level of pain and disturbing body sensations.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about an individual's level of pain and disturbing body sensations.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Pain 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Pain and No Disturbing Body Sensations

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Pain and No Disturbing Body Sensations
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no pain and no disturbing body sensations.

Concepts.longName: No Pain and No Disturbing Body Sensations
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no pain and no disturbing body sensations.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mild Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations Not Limiting Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mild Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations Not Limiting Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual had mild pain or disturbing body sensations, but  that they do or did not limit activities.

Concepts.longName: Mild Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations Not Limiting Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual had mild pain or disturbing body sensations, but  that they do or did not limit activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Few Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Few Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate pain or disturbing body sensations that limited a few activities.

Concepts.longName: Moderate Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Few Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate pain or disturbing body sensations that limited a few activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate to Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Some Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate to Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Some Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate to severe pain or disturbing body sensations that limited some activities

Concepts.longName: Moderate to Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Some Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate to severe pain or disturbing body sensations that limited some activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Many Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Many Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe pain or disturbing body sensations that limited many activities.

Concepts.longName: Severe Pain or Disturbing Body Sensations that Limit Many Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe pain or disturbing body sensations that limited many activities.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your pain and disturbing body sensations in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
